intro: Bastardia violacea, commonly known as the violet bastardia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are usually purple or violet in color, with five petals arranged symmetrically. Bastardia violacea is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions, making it a hardy plant in arid climates.
